name: Aulani, a Disney Resort & Spa

reviews.text: We visited Aulani in 2012 and 2013 for a total of two weeks and love this place. Food is a little pricey at the resort but there are many restaurants in the area (walking distance) and if you are. DVC member and have a kitchen, target and costco are a few miles away. I recommend Aulani for a couples getaway with no kids or a family getaway with kids, either way you cannot go wrong with Aulani.
reviews.title: Aulani, now out favorite place to stay of all the islands.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I were stupid enough to bring kids to Hawaii (6000 miles from home) I would recommend staying here. We are vacation club owners residing in Orlando and use the accomodations to tour the parks and rest at night. But touring Oahu and resting at night will be difficult here.
reviews.title: If I were stupid enough

reviews.text: We are on the twelfth floor poolside and the noise comes thru windows most of the night. The noise is the kids screaming, the band playing or the unnatural sound of water flowing thru the pool system.
reviews.title: Disney tops itself with this resort!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Aulani's neighbor's are direct about the poor relationship Disney has here in the neighborhood. It is the Disney way to be self contained. On the other hand the restaurants and other hotels have discounts but Disney doesn't participate. Fortunately I obtained discount coupon for area restaurants from a kind person. This allowed 10% of at area restaurants.
reviews.title: Hawaiian Paradise

reviews.text: This side of Oahu is a pleasant spot to relax after site seeing. Waikiki is craziness. Know that you have options here for food and entertainment within walking distance off property.
reviews.title: Go for the water slides, not the hotel

reviews.text: Great place to go for family with 5~8 yr olds. I recommend the rooms that have direct access to the pool are from the balcony. We rented a cabana.. it was really nice. Your kids will love this place.
reviews.title: Greatest family destination in Hawaii

reviews.text: I'll definitely go there again next time I go to Hawaii.
reviews.title: Attention to detail - Welcome Home

reviews.text: As they are fond of saying, Welcome Home.
reviews.title: Fun for everyone
A World Class Resort Hawaii Can be Proud Of
reviews.text: The attention you receive from the time you pull up to unload your belongings and check in - is top notch Disney customer service.
We traveled with another couple who belong to the DVC and we shared a 2bd 2.5 bath suite.
reviews.title: 4.5 stars if I could...

reviews.text: For many months I had been reading trip advisor reviews about Aulani, most good, some not so good, so I didn't really know what to expect but went with an open mind and positive attitude. After a 10 hour flight from New York, we arrived in Oahu and picked up our rental car and hit the H1 where there was a ton of rush hour traffic. For my first time in Hawaii, Oahu was not what I expected. It is not very tropical looking in Honolulu and I felt somewhat disappointed. When we arrived at the Ko 'Olina exit, I finally felt like I had finally arrived in Hawaii. The area where Aulani is is very beautiful and lush. There are homes at the golf course and time share hotels as well. When we arrived at Aulani we had our car valet parked and were greeted with leis that smelled amazing! The hotel is beautiful and meticulously maintained. We found the valets, bellmen, front desk staff, waiters, housekeepers and other workers to be super friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Great trip!
Disney, At their finest!
reviews.text: My husband, I and 12 year old daughter stayed for 10 days in a garden view room, as we are not DVC members. When we checked in our requested room for a king bed and queen pullout was not available but we were able to switch the next day to a different room which had the beds we originally requested. Even though our room overlooked the parking garage, we had a beautiful view of the mountains and ocean in the distance. The rooms were well kept and very nice. Sometimes housekeeping came later in the day (after 4:00) which was sometimes an inconvenience but not a big deal for us. I had stopped by Target one day and bought supplies to make peanut butter and jelly sandwiches and instant oatmeal and muffins for breakfast as my daughter and I are not big breakfast eaters. My husband would get something from the continental breakfast area at the Olelo room which he always enjoyed. Sometimes we would go next door to the Starbucks in the Marriott as well. We bought the refillable mugs ($18. each) which you can fill up throughout the day with coffee, tea, hot chocolate, soda and water. We ate lunch most days by the pool using waiter service and did different things for dinner. We ate on property a few nights. One night we ate at Ama Ama which we found to be excellent, once at the buffet which was good and also at the Olelo room happy hour between 5-7 where we had good food and musical entertainment. Our favorite dinner spot though was at Roys across the street at the gold course. The food was outstanding (and pricey). We ate there twice!! You may want to make a reservation but they do take walk-ins as well. The drinks at the hotel were good, not very strong and the waiter service was very convenient at the pool and on the beach. Be sure to get the shaved ice a few times as well!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In regards to reserving seats at the pool, make sure you get them early if you want a particular spot or an umbrella. My husband is an early riser and got us seats each day. The staff does watch the chairs and will remove your belongings after an hour as we witnessed happen to others. If you see your towels folded up, that means they are keeping tabs on how long you haven't been using your chairs. As long as you unfold your towels, the chairs are still yours for a while longer. We made sure to check back at our seats every so often as to not have a problem. One guy even kept a chart of where you were sitting and how long you were gone! If for some reason you have a late start, you will definitely find chairs on the deck in front of Ama Ama. There were always empty chairs there and a beautiful view of the ocean. Don't forget each day to get a different wrist band at the towel stands so they know you are a guest there. The color changes each day. Towel stand opens around 8:00am. Also, get clean towels before you head up to your room each night so you have them to put on your chairs in the morning to reserve them.
reviews.title: Getting Better Every Day

reviews.text: As far as entertainment, especially for our 12 year old, there is plenty to do. The pools, lazy river and water slides were a lot of fun. Be sure to try them at night as well! Lazy river and slides are open until 8:00 and the pool closes at 10:00. Sometimes you have to wait on lines, but never more than 15 minutes. My daughter did 2 premium activities (extra expense around $80. each) in Aunty's beach house. She attended Surf's Up with Chip and Dale and Fish are Friends. Both were 3 hours and included a meal and gifts at the end. Even though she was one of the oldest at each activity, she had a great time. I booked these activities a month in advance as they usually are sold out early. I also booked the character breakfast and Ama Ama a month before we arrived to ensure the days and times I wanted. We all paid to snorkel in Rainbow Reef for the length of stay (this is only $5. more than the single day price). Try to go in during fish feeding as it's a wonderful experience! We also snorkeled in the lagoon in front of Aulani and to the lagoon to the left of Aulani's property. There are 4 lagoons in all that are calm and have tons of sea life to see. We did find another snorkeling area to the right of Aulani past the Marriott kind of off the beaten path. If you go there wear something on your feet as the terrain can be rocky. The area in the water is very rocky as well so be careful getting in. This was our favorite snorkeling spot of all as there is a ton to see! The sunsets at that spot are also spectacular. We tried paddle boarding one day and that was fun. I believe it was $30. for an hour and it is first-come first-served, no sign-up available. My daughter also did the Menehune Adventure Trail which is an interactive game throughout the resort. It is free to play between 10-7 but you need your room card to sign out the device to use. This can be found in the Pau Hana room. If you have done the Kim Possible game in EPCOT or have been on the Disney cruise, you will be familiar with the format of the game. There is a pool party with the characters twice a week and there is also something called Aloha Fun with Disney Friends where you interact with select characters.
reviews.title: AMAZING TIME!!!

reviews.text: We attended the Starlit Hui twice. This is Aulani's version of a Luau, except without the food. The pre-show starts at 7:30, but get there before 7:00 to ensure seating up close. The activities team keeps you entertained as you are waiting in line with trivia questions and small prizes. The pre-show consists of learning the hula, making crafts and playing games. The actual show starts at 8:00 and goes until 8:30. The Disney characters come out at the end and dance. You can then wait on line for pictures with them afterwards. Character meetings are scheduled throughout the day; just check your daily Iwa for the times. You will get the Iwa in your room each night during turn down service that will list the activities for the next day. If you want to attend a true luau, there is one on selected nights at Paradise Cove within walking distance of the hotel. There is also an intra-resort shuttle that runs each day/night that you can catch for free. Check for the times in your Iwa.
reviews.title: Another day in paradise

reviews.text: We picked Aulani due to the kid friendly activities and options galore!! The service was great. We upgraded into a two bedroom suite which I highly recommend. It was great to do breakfast and have snacks on hand in the room. The restaurants on site were not our favorite, however sufficient. The kids were reluctant at first about Aunties house, but once we did the open house with them they saw how awesome it was. I also felt safe leaving the kids there. I also felt safe allowing the kids to run back and forth from the pools and the beach. I would recommend buying the mugs upon arrival for free soda and coffee the extent of your stay. We did wish that there were some more ocean activities, however were in no way disappointed, our kids are just getting a big older and ready for more than playing in the sand and the paddle board and such were limited to back and forth in the lagoon.
reviews.title: A must for a family vacation
The Beautiful Aulani
reviews.text: What an amazing place -- something for everyone. We were in the Lazy River everyday. Relaxing and fun place. We also loved making our own Leis from the beautiful fresh flowers that are flown in from Maui everyday -- worth it!!

Our family of 9 has made annual trips to all the Hawaiian Islands for 8 years experimenting with various hotels and resorts. Well that will stop now because we found one that has everything we want. Disney;s Aulani Hotel. Yes, its expensive, Yes, it can be crowded but the location, the pools, lazy river, lagoon, snorkeling, Aunte's Playhouse, dining, activities, everything is there so why go someone else. KIds will love this place and so will adults. Having been to the best on all the Islands the Aulani is the perfect family location.
reviews.title: Family Paradise

reviews.text: We had an excellent extended weekend trip to Aulani. The pools were clean with plenty of room, the service was impeccable, the rooms were spacious and clean. I read reviews and must agree that the food prices were extremely high. If you choose a villa with a kitchen, the holiday would be perfect as you wouldn't have to worry about food prices.
reviews.title: Paradise for the family
Outstanding Resort
reviews.text: There are so many favorites from our short stay, here is an overview:

aka: Aulani, a Disney Resort And Spa In Hawai`i
